item.title: World of Warcraft Dragonflight - Launch Trailer

item.title: Destiny 2 Players Aren't Happy With Reward From Final Seasonal Mission
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Veiled Threats quest in Destiny 2 offers underwhelming loot upon multiple completions.
  • Season of the Wish's final mission may leave players disappointed with defunct gear mods.
  • The quest is still worth playing for those who haven't completed it yet, as they can get ascendant shards, unique ships, and exciting cutscene.

The new Veiled Threats quest in Destiny 2 offers an exciting conclusion to the game's final season of the year, though players who have finished the seasonal content on multiple characters have noticed that this final mission can actually drop some hilariously underwhelming loot. While many of the reward drops in Destiny 2 have been turned up prior to the launch of the game's Final Shape expansion in just over a week, players will have to act fast if they hope to complete all the content from this year's seasons and the Into the Light update before it's gone for good.

Season of the Wish was met largely with positive reception following its release - an especially good thing, considering the season stands out as the longest-running season in Destiny 2 's history after it was extended due to The Final Shape's delay. The season's story has focused on Guardians working with the paracausal apparition of the last Ahamkara, Riven, in order to forge a pathway to the Pale Heart - the strange new destination where players will find themselves in Destiny 2 's upcoming Final Shape expansion .

Related
Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards

The weekly reset for Destiny 2 is live and here are all of the new details including Nightfall strike, seasonal missions, challenges, and much more.

While Season of the Wish has given Guardians the opportunity to earn tons of good loot, particularly with the introduction of the lucrative Coil seasonal activity, the season's final mission has left players with some rather disappointing loot in some cases. A popular post recently made on Reddit by the user PrimitusVictor shows off exactly what players get when they complete the Veiled Threats quest on any other character after finishing it once - nothing more than a fizzled gear mod, which is now completely useless after being removed from the game long ago. While this certainly isn't the only time Destiny 2 has dropped some woeful loot into players' hands, it's difficult not to find this instance kind of funny, as the defunct mod actually dismantles into components that have also been removed from the game.

Why Players Shouldn't Sleep on Season of the Wish's Conclusive Mission

It's worth noting that these defunct gear mods are only given to players after they've completed the final seasonal mission at least once on any character. For players who haven't yet had a chance to play through the mission, it's absolutely worth it - if not for the free ascendant shard and unique ship it awards upon completion, then definitely for the fantastic cutscene that's sure to get players pumped for Destiny 2 's next big expansion if they weren't already.

Still, players should make the most of the time left before the release of The Final Shape expansion, as there are plenty of preparations to be made before June 4. For a limited time only, players can also earn more shiny weapons by playing Destiny 2 's Onslaught activity , and completions of seasonal activities also guarantee deepsight weapon drops until June 4.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: How To Use 1 Supply (Daily Activity)
item.description:
It's a common thing for games to have daily missions to incentivize their players to return every day, and Wuthering Waves is no different. In WuWa , Rovers must complete the daily activity if they wish to obtain 60 Astrite . Those who missed a day will not get the resources back, so it's important to log in every day.

Among the many tasks in WuWa daily activities, players may get one that tells them to use 1 supply in Wuthering Waves . Although it feels abstract and unclear, this mission is one of the easiest to complete, so players should look forward to it.

Related
Wuthering Waves: Calcharo Build Guide

Calcharo is an Electro main DPS that players can get in the Standard Banner in Wuthering Waves.

How To Use 1 Supply In Wuthering Waves Daily Activity

To use 1 supply in Wuthering Waves , players simply need to:

  • Open their backpack (inventory)
  • Choose supply on the left side of the screen (medicine symbol)
  • Use any supply in the tab

After using 1 supply, players will complete the daily activity in their Wuthering Waves guidebook . This mission grants 20pts out of the 100 required to complete the dailies.

Rovers can access their inventory by either pressing the backpack icon next to their map or heading to the menu and then choosing backpack.

Supply In Wuthering Waves

Players can get more supplies in Wuthering Waves by either cooking dishes on a stove or making potions in the synthesizer. Here are some of the easiest items to make to complete the use 1 supply task in WuWa :

Supply

Ingredients

Effect

Basic Revival Inhaler

  • 2x Noctemint

Heal a downed Resonator for 100 HP. This can only be used once every 60s.

Basic Nutrient Block

  • 2x Dewvetch

Heal a selected Resonator for 10% of their max HP + 500.

Basic Energy Bag

  • 2x Lemongrass

Heal a selected Resonator for 100 HP per second for 30s.

Jinzhou Skewers

  • 2x Raw Meat
  • 1x Lemongrass

All party members ATK +100 for 15m.

Noctemint, Dewvetch, and Lemongrass are all common flora that can be found all over Jinzhou. Unlike materials such as Pecok Flower in Wuthering Waves , these three are considered materials for cooking and synthesis, so players don't have to worry about needing them for character ascension materials.

Meanwhile, Raw Meat is easily obtainable by hitting animals in the open world, such as rabbits, goats, and cows. Naturally, the bigger the animal, the more drops they give. These animals only need one hit to grant their drop, but players must ensure the character hits them as they will try to run away, and some characters don't auto-target the roaming creatures.

Unlike Raw Meat in Genshin Impact , the drops given by animals in Wuthering Waves are automatically added to the player's inventory, so there's no need to search for them and pick them up. This is mostly nice when players hit some birds, which will give them Fowls.

item.title: Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door — How to Beat Iron Cleft
item.description:
During their journey in Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door , players will come up against many difficult foes. However, none are quite as difficult as the Iron Clefts found in the Glitz Pit. After Mario finds the way to Glitzville , he'll join the popular fighting arena and battle his way to the top.

Starting in the minor leagues, players should easily make their way up to their qualifying match at Rank 11. But when Mario goes up against the Ranked 10 Iron Adonis Twins, players will find themselves in an impossibly difficult scenario: their opponents' iron hides are too tough to pierce.

Related
Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door - How to Do Stylish Moves

Stylish Moves are a great way to increase your Star Power in Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door. Here's how you can perform them.

How to Beat the Iron Adonis Twins

Though most of the combatants in Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door talk a big game in the Glitz Pit, few can back up their claims as strongly as the Iron Adonis Twins. With an official defense of ??? , it's surprising that this dynamic duo sits at the bottom of the major league rankings.

With the help of one of the game's partner abilities , players can get all the information they can about the two Iron Clefts. Goombella's Tattle will reveal that no attack will work against their tough exterior, and suggests that, if true, the only way to beat one is to whack it with the other. Unfortunately, neither Mario nor any of his partners in the ring have the ability to do anything of the sort.

The Iron Adonis Twins are impossible to beat the first time around. Though it might seem counter-intuitive to some, the only way to progress in the game is to lose or flee from the fight. Mario will get knocked out and return to the minor league locker room, but not without earning his one-coin consolation prize.

If players previously saved the Mystic Egg from the hot dog stand, a new partner to join Mario's party will be waiting for them in the locker room. If not, players will need to exit the Glitz Pit and help chase it around the plaza outside.

With the Mystic Egg now in tow, Mario and company can return to the Glitz Pit. The egg is set to hatch after losing the match against the Iron Adonis Twins, so return to the ring and lose the match once again.

The egg hatches into the party's latest addition, a young Yoshi with a fiery passion for battle. Though his stats and abilities are always the same, players can pick Yoshi's color by resetting and waiting a different amount of time before hatching.

Yoshi excitedly joins the party and brings with him a winning strategy against the Iron Clefts. Players can immediately sign up for another ranked match to hop back into the ring and take Yoshi for a test drive. Facing off yet again, the Iron Adonis Twins start the match with some more trash talk before diving in.

When it's Yoshi's turn to attack, players can use his Gulp to inhale one of the Iron Clefts and spit it at the other. Ideally, players should rest before entering the fight or at least have enough FP on hand, as Gulp costs a whopping 4 FP per use.

The attack will damage both of the Iron Clefts, and set Mario on the path to victory. Make sure to protect Yoshi as the fight goes on, as he'll need to keep using Gulp to win the bout. In the end, the party reigns victorious and Mario advances to the much nicer major league locker room.

item.title: GreedFall 2's Lore Shouldn't Fall Far from the De Sardet Family Tree
item.description:
Highlights

  • GreedFall focuses on rich storytelling akin to old-school BioWare games, with strong characters driving the plot effectively.
  • The history of the protagonist's family, particularly De Sardet, remains shrouded in mystery and deserves more exploration.
  • GreedFall 2: The Dying World should provide more extensive exposition on the protagonist's backstory to avoid past storytelling mistakes.

GreedFall is a very story-rich experience, as it prioritizes narrative above almost everything else. Of course, this is primarily on account of it being very similar to old-school BioWare games like Dragon Age: Origins and Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic , which were specifically designed to essentially be choose-your-own-adventure novels brought to life. In GreedFall , its characters are its strong suit, which is precisely how its story and worldbuilding are as effective as they are. However, GreedFall didn't get everything right from a storytelling perspective, as it neglected to delve too deep into the history of its protagonist's family.

De Sardet is the central protagonist and player character of GreedFall . As the Legate of New Serene, De Sardet travels to Teer Fradee along with their cousin, Constantin d'Orsay, in search of a cure for the Malichor disease their mother is plagued by and to establish a foothold for the Congregation of Merchants on the island. Unfortunately, there are still a lot of unanswered questions by the time the credits roll, and this is something GreedFall 2: The Dying World could afford to remedy and also take note of when it comes to its own protagonist.

Related
GreedFall 2: Why a Far Bigger Role for Mev Seems Inevitable

GreedFall's Mev is almost guaranteed a bigger role in GreedFall 2: The Dying World, after confirmations made by Spiders and the game's trailer.

GreedFall 2 Should Fill in the History of the De Sardet Family and Ensure Its Own Protagonist Doesn't Meet the Same Fate

GreedFall 2 Should Dive Deeper Into the History of the De Sardet Family

As the story of GreedFall progresses, one thing becomes clear: the history of the De Sardet family is chock-full of secrets. In fact, it is eventually revealed that De Sardet isn't of noble descent at all and is instead a Teer Fradee native. This shocking truth is frequently hinted at throughout the story of GreedFall until it is finally confirmed by Admiral Cabral after completing a certain quest.

As it turns out, De Sardet had been lied to by their family, even the Princess Livie De Sardet, their "mother" they traveled to Teer Fradee to find a cure for.

De Sardet's real mother was actually kidnapped by the Congregation of Merchants during her pregnancy, and De Sardet was then born on the Naut ship that was transporting them to the Old Continent of Gacane . Upon their arrival, De Sardet's mother was taken prisoner and De Sardet was given to Prince d'Orsay's sister, Livie De Sardet. Livie then raised De Sardet as her own daughter, and De Sardet never knew any better.

Despite giving some backstory to De Sardet's true family, the history of the De Sardet family remains largely a mystery. As the story of GreedFall 's protagonist has shown, the De Sardet family's history is shrouded in mystery, founded upon secrets and lies that were largely ignored throughout the game's narrative.

This is especially unfortunate considering how compelling of a character Princess Livie De Sardet is and how little is known about her and her husband, who most likely died before she began raising De Sardet. While it hasn't been confirmed whether any members of the De Sardet family will make an appearance in GreedFall 2 , there may not be a better time to divulge more of their history.

The Backstory of GreedFall 2's Protagonist Deserves More Extensive Exposition Than the De Sardet Family Received

Even if the De Sardet family doesn't make an appearance in GreedFall 2 , the sequel should still ensure it doesn't make the same mistake twice.

Plenty of information was given about De Sardet's personal history in the first game, but the history of the family they grew up with was largely neglected. As such, GreedFall 2 's protagonist deserves an extensive exposition to learn more about their own history and the history of their ancestors.
